name: market for operation, internet access equipment | operation, internet access equipment | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1340/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'operation, internet access equipment', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;The 'operation, internet access equipment' is delivering the service of operation of an internet access equipment that is used for one hour, per work station. The equipment consists of an ADSL modem with router (0.0042kW) and DSLAM (0.0013 kW) per end user. The operation includes the device use and the electricity consumption.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: J:Information and communication/61:Telecommunications/611:Wired telecommunications activities/6110:Wired telecommunications activities
